subject: Art & Design
title: Scale and Proportion: Size as Communication
description: A 60-second lesson on Scale and Proportion: Size as Communication.

hook.text: Make a word ten times bigger and it becomes a shout. Shrink it and it becomes a whisper. Size is volume.

buildup.text: Scale is the size of an element relative to others. Proportion is the size relationship between parts of one element.

discovery.text: Large elements grab attention first. Small elements are read second. Scale dictates reading order.

twist.text: Unexpected scale creates impact: a tiny figure in a vast landscape, or a massive close-up of a small object.

climax.text: Consistent proportions across a design system create harmony. Breaking proportion creates focal points.

punchline.text: Scale isn't decoration. It's a hierarchy tool with volume control.

quiz.question: What does unexpected scale create in a design?
options: Visual impact and focal points that draw attention
